titles.title: Fair Credit Reporting Amendments of 1993
To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to require prompt disclosure by any consumer reporting agency to any consumer of adverse information relating to such consumer which is received by such agency.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Consumer Credit and Insurance.

committee.name: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 1/26/1993--Introduced. Fair Credit Reporting Amendments of 1993 - Amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to require consumer reporting agencies to disclose promptly to a consumer any adverse information the agency receives. Directs the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to prescribe regulations defining "adverse information."
